result.execSummary:
The defendant Allyssa Ann Wamego was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.

The defendant may not have any contact with Calvin Fowler.
The defendant must undergo anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Must be completed within the first year of probation.

#1 - Letter from Ministry Health Care
Does not plan to seek

Defendant Allyssa Ann Wamego in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Allyssa Ann Wamego in custody.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:18 PM. Lynch and State have revocation paperwork. Lynch finds no inaccuracies. State makes final argument prior to recommendation - parties do stipulate to 166 days jail credit - has reviewed exhibit #1 as submitted by Lynch - recommends 8 months on each count - concurrent to each other - with credit for 166 days. Lynch makes final argument prior to recommendation - recommends 7 months jail on each count - concurrent to each other - with credit for 166 days and basically time served. Wamego makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on all three counts (#2, #5 and #7) - 8 months in FC jail on each count - concurrent to each other - huber and good time allowed - credit for 166 days, turn any unpaid fines into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Received 10/18/16 Request for fulough - Approved - Release 9:45 AM and return 6:15 PM on 10/20/16 - No consumption of alcohol. Also, providing no violations of prior furloughs. (One request ws also sent on 10/17/16, however the dates given by Wamego were incorrect)
Request/Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation - 30 days of jail, will not be served with huber privileges.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Allyssa Ann Wamego in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns - Attorney Burns appears in person in Florence County and are appearing via video in Forest County.  Defendant Allyssa Ann Wamego in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Stenz and reporter Jezeski appear in person in Florence County and are appearing via video in Forest County. Called at 11:44 AM. State - Wamego will be pleading today. Court goes thru collaquey with the defendant in regards to him appearing via video as she has the right to have all parties appear in person. Wamego understands and wishes to proceed today in this format. Court will allow the plea and sentencing to proceed today. State - has complied with victim notification requirements with no VIS or request for restitution - resolved - moves to amend #7 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - class A misd, defendant would then plead G plea to amended counts #7, count #2 as aleged and count #5 as alleged, DRI remaining counts, joint recommendation of a witheld sentence and place on probation for 2 years on each count with conditions of: #2 - $300 fine plus costs and surcharges, #5 and #7 - court costs only, other conditions include: AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars, or similar Class B establishments,  employment/school, 100 hours of community service, no contact with Calvin Fowler. Burns and Wamego agree. Wamego pleads G to counts #2, #5 and #7. Court amends count #7 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - reads new charge and penalty. Wamego pleads G to amended count #7. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for 12 days if revoked (stipulated). Wamego withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2, #5 and #7 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain/maintain full time employment/school, no contact with Calvin Fowler, 100 hours of community service tota - to be performed within the first year of probation, count #2 - $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - paid thru probation, counts #5 and #7 - court costs only - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample with expunction rights, Court dismisses and reads in remaining counts, credit for 12 days only if revoked, right to appeal, adjourned.
Defendant

Defendant Allyssa Ann Wamego in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:32 PM. State - believe PH will be waived - State has filed an Amended Information this morning. Burns agrees and does have amended criminal complaint and provides court with waiver of PH form. Court goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Burns has Information, will proceed to ARGN, waives reading of Information and pleads NG to all counts. Court continues bond and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Defendant states concern to Ms. Burns. Burns puts concern on the record.

Called at 1:47 PM. 15-10065. Alyssa Wamego appears via video from FOSO and her attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns - here for bail bond review - asks for reduction in bond - requests signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections to a reduction in bond but wants substantial conditions on bond if reduced (no contact with Calvin Fowler except for child exchange/visitation, no consumption of alcohol, not to operate a motor vehicle. Burns - objects to the condition of not to operate a motor vehicle. Court - reduces bond to $3000 signature with conditions of: no consumption of alcohol, no contact with Calvin Fowler, not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license except for emergencies or medical care for the child, set for INIT on 7/8/15 at 9:30 AM.
